summary.part1: Hi! I'm Avital, a passionate developer focused on creating engaging web experiences. Feel free to navigate around, and don't forget to try out the game mode for a fun twist on the usual browsing experience!
summary.part2: A bit about me: I'm currently in my fifth co-op term at the University of Waterloo, studying Systems Design Engineering. I'm passionate about working with and improving UI, learning new technologies, and developing reusable code architecture.
experience: 4+ years with ReactJS, Next.js, and Node.js
4+ years with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, CSS
Highly familiar with RESTful APIs, TailwindCSS, Git, Agile workflows
Comfortable with Figma, Photoshop, and UI/UX design principles
Actively expanding backend & machine learning experience

aboutSection.title: About Me
aboutSection.subtitle: I enjoy building thoughtful, interactive web experiences with a strong focus on frontend development. Currently in my fifth co-op term and graduating soon, I’ve spent the last few years working with React, TypeScript, and modern web tools.

card1.title: User-Centered Engineering
card1.content: I like building interfaces that feel clear, responsive, and easy to use. My goal is always to turn real user needs into clean, scalable UI that works well across devices.

prioritiesDetail.title: My Approach to UI/UX
list: Building reusable, maintainable components that grow with the product
Keeping accessibility, usability, and visual clarity in mind from the start
Thinking about performance early instead of treating it as a last step

card2.title: Learning by Building
card2.content: I approach frontend work with a full-stack mindset. Having experience with backend systems helps me build frontend features that are more reliable, efficient, and easier to maintain.

prioritiesDetail.title: What I Bring to the Table
list: Hands-on experience with React, Next.js, TypeScript, HTML, CSS, and modern JavaScript
Backend exposure using Node.js, Python, C++, and RESTful APIs
A strong habit of using version control, writing clear documentation, and testing my work

card3.title: Product Mindset
card3.content: I don’t just focus on writing code: I like understanding the bigger picture. Working closely with designers and other developers helps me ship features that make sense for everyone.

prioritiesDetail.title: How I Work
list: Turning designs and product ideas into polished, production-ready UI
Writing clean, readable code that’s easy to pick up and iterate on
Learning from feedback and continuously improving both the code and the user experience

projectsSection.title: Projects
projectsSection.subtitle: Here are a few highlights of my work. For more details, check out my

project1.title: Gamified Website
project1.description: This is what you're looking at now if you're on a larger screen! A pixel-art style website featuring an interactive game, built using React, Next.js, and Phaser.js to showcase reusable components, game logic, and responsive design
project1.toolsUsed: React, Next.js, TypeScript, Phaser.js, Tailwind CSS, HTML

project2.title: UW Baja SAE
project2.description: I took on the role of Lead Frontend Developer for our design team's website redesign, focusing on responsive UI, reusable components, and ease of use. I also integrated EmailJS for seamless contact form functionality, and Netlify for deployment and domain management.
project2.toolsUsed: React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, HTML, Figma, EmailJS, Netlify

project3.title: Intro to Machine Learning
project3.description: During Fall 2025, I completed a Study Abroad term in Madrid, Spain. There, I took a course on Machine Learning, where I built projects using Python and popular ML libraries.
project3.toolsUsed: Python, scikit-learn, Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, Jupyter Notebooks, Streamlit
